newsitem.title: RUSSIA: NORDIC SKIING-VAELBE TAKES OVERALL WORLD CUP LEAD.
newsitem.headline: NORDIC SKIING-VAELBE TAKES OVERALL WORLD CUP LEAD.

text.p: Russia's Yelena Vaelbe won a women's World Cup Nordic skiing race on home territory on Sunday to take the overall lead in this season's competition.

Vaelbe clocked 47 minutes 32.6 seconds in the 15 km classic cross-country race to finish ahead of Larisa Lazutina and Lyubov Yegorova in a Russian clean sweep in hilly terrain outside St Petersburg, where the air and snow temperature was minus 11 degrees centigrade.
She finished more than two minutes ahead of Italy's Stefania Belmondo, who was 13th, to replace her as overall leader after five stages of this season's World Cup.
"I love this course, though it is a complicated one," Vaelbe said. "I felt sure of myself and wanted to win very much."
Vaelbe, who took the lead in the race after trailing Lazutina for the first two kilometres, said she now had her sights set on winning the World Cup.
